decks.notes: The main focus of this deck is to quickly and aggressively deal damage to the opponent using a combination of creatures and burn spells. With efficient creatures like Robber of the Rich and Kumano Faces Kakkazan, along with powerful burn spells like Lightning Strike and Burst Lightning, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent's defenses and finish the game quickly. Cards like Reckless Rage and Monstrous Rage provide additional removal and damage, while Ramunap Ruins and Mutavault offer additional sources of damage. Overall, the deck is designed to be fast-paced and relentless in its pursuit of victory.

This deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with spells to bring back Arclight Phoenix from the graveyard, utilizing cards like Treasure Cruise and Consider to draw into more spells. Lightning Axe and Fiery Impulse provide removal options while Picklock Prankster can disrupt opponents' plans. The deck's mana base allows for consistent casting of spells and the inclusion of Proft's Eidetic Memory allows for potential card advantage. The goal is to overwhelm opponents with a flurry of spells and creatures, pushing for a fast-paced and aggressive gameplay style.

This Selesnya Aggro deck focuses on quickly building a board presence with low-cost creatures like Elvish Mystic and Llanowar Elves, while disrupting the opponent with cards like Archon of Emeria and Thalia, Guardian of Thraben. Collected Company allows for explosive plays by putting even more creatures on the battlefield. Skyclave Apparition and Aven Interrupter provide removal options, while Boseiju, Who Endures and Eiganjo, Seat of the Empire help protect key creatures. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy, backed up by a mix of disruption and protection.

This deck focuses on controlling the game by utilizing counterspells, board wipes, and disruption spells to prevent the opponent from executing their game plan. The inclusion of Yorion as a companion allows for additional value through blinking permanents for card advantage and tempo advantage. The deck also includes a variety of lands to ensure color consistency and flexibility in casting spells. Overall, the deck aims to stall the game out and outvalue the opponent in the late game with powerful finishers like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria.

The deck focuses on utilizing a combination of efficient creatures and disruption spells to maintain pressure on the opponent while controlling the game. By combining aggressive threats like Floodpits Drowner and Spyglass Siren with powerful disruption tools like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while steadily advancing its own. The inclusion of Sheoldred, the Apocalypse provides a powerful late-game threat that can quickly close out games. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggression and disruption.

This deck focuses on utilizing the combo of Greasefang and Parhelion II to create a powerful synergy. The deck includes cards that support this combo such as Fleeting Spirit, Sheltered by Ghosts, and Seasoned Hallowblade. It also includes removal options like Fatal Push and disruption spells like Thoughtseize to control the game. The mana base is set up to support the combo with options for white and black mana sources. Overall, the key goal of the deck is to assemble the combo pieces and overwhelm the opponent with a powerful board presence.

The main concept of this Red Deck Wins aggro deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with fast, aggressive creatures and burn spells. Using efficient creatures like Emberheart Challenger and Heartfire Hero, along with direct damage spells like Burst Lightning and Lightning Strike, the deck aims to deal damage to the opponent as quickly as possible. With cards like Kumano Faces Kakkazan and Reckless Rage for additional removal and reach, this deck focuses on a proactive strategy to win the game before the opponent can stabilize.

The main concept of this Aggro Red Deck Wins deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells to deal damage quickly and efficiently. With a focus on fast creatures like Soul-Scar Mage and Kumano Faces Kakkazan, along with burn spells like Burst Lightning and Monstrous Rage, the deck aims to establish board presence and pressure the opponent early on. The inclusion of utility lands like Den of the Bugbear and Ramunap Ruins helps maintain a consistent stream of damage, while cards like Sokenzan, Crucible of Defiance provide additional value and flexibility in the late game.

This Rakdos Aggro deck focuses on aggressive early game plays and disruption through hand disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Duress. Additionally, the deck includes removal spells like Fatal Push and Go for the Throat to clear the way for aggressive creatures such as Bloodtithe Harvester and Kroxa, Titan of Death's Hunger. The deck also utilizes cards like Fable of the Mirror-Breaker and Fear of Missing Out to maintain pressure on opponents. Lastly, the deck incorporates cards like Blackcleave Cliffs and Mutavault for mana acceleration and flexibility in the mana base.

This Rakdos Aggro deck focuses on aggressive plays and disruption to quickly overwhelm opponents. Utilizing cards like Bloodtithe Harvester and Fable of the Mirror-Breaker, along with removal spells like Fatal Push and Go for the Throat, the deck aims to control the board while dealing consistent damage. Graveyard Trespasser and Thoughtseize provide valuable hand disruption, while Mutavault and Blazemire Verge offer additional creature threats. By combining efficient creatures, removal, and disruption, this deck aims to pressure opponents and close out games quickly with a strong aggro strategy.

The deck revolves around using Lotus Field to generate a large amount of mana to power out powerful combo pieces such as Scapeshift and Thassa's Oracle. The deck includes cards that help tutor for key pieces, protect the combo, and provide additional win conditions. Utilizing lands like Crumbling Vestige and Arboreal Grazer, the deck aims to quickly assemble the combo pieces and win the game in a single turn. With careful planning and sequencing, the deck can quickly overwhelm opponents and secure victory through its powerful synergy and efficient mana generation.

The deck focuses on aggressively applying pressure on the opponent using a mix of efficient creatures and disruptive spells. It aims to maintain a fast clock with creatures like Bloodtithe Harvester and Fear of Missing Out while also disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Thoughtseize and Duress. The inclusion of powerful finishers like Sheoldred, the Apocalypse and Kroxa, Titan of Death's Hunger allows the deck to close out games quickly. The versatility of the deck comes from its ability to switch between aggression and disruption based on the matchup, making it a formidable force in the Pioneer format.

The main focus of this Red Deck Wins archetype is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and direct damage spells. By consistently playing low-cost creatures and burn spells, the deck aims to apply pressure early in the game and finish off the opponent before they can stabilize. With a mix of creatures with haste and direct damage spells, the deck can quickly chip away at the opponent's life total and close out the game efficiently. This deck prioritizes speed and efficiency in order to outpace the opponent and secure a victory.

This deck focuses on assembling the combo of Greasefang, Okiba Boss and Parhelion II to create a powerful synergistic interaction. The deck includes cards that can protect and support the combo pieces, as well as disruption in the form of Thoughtseize and Fatal Push to control the opponent's game plan. The lands in the deck are carefully selected to support the combo and ensure consistent mana production. By utilizing the combo effectively, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents and secure victory in Pioneer 1 vs 1 matches.

The main focus of this UW Control deck is to establish control over the game through various counterspells, removal spells, and card draw. The deck utilizes powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Narset, Parter of Veils to gain card advantage and disrupt the opponent's strategy. March of Otherworldly Light and Supreme Verdict offer board wipe options, while cards like No More Lies and Get Lost provide additional disruption. With a mix of control elements and card advantage, this deck aims to outlast the opponent and win the game through incremental advantage.

This deck focuses on quickly deploying artifact creatures and enchanting them with Ensoul Artifact to turn them into powerful threats. By using cards like Mockingbird and Voldaren Epicure, along with burn spells like Torch the Tower and Shrapnel Blast, the deck aims to deal damage quickly and efficiently. The inclusion of counter spells like Metallic Rebuke and Into the Flood Maw helps protect your key threats while also disrupting your opponent's game plan. Overall, this deck is all about aggressive play and overwhelming your opponent with a flurry of threats.
